title: What it will take to free two Canadians detained in China for more than two years
description: From her home in Toronto, Vina Nadjibulla fields hundreds of emails, texts, and phone calls, all about the only person she really wants to hear from.

title: North Korea conducts first weapons test of Biden's presidency
description: North Korea carried out a weapons test last weekend, launching two projectiles, according to three US officials. The move was widely expected as Kim Jong Un sends a message to the Biden administration about the country's importance in the region.

title: Teen learns she got into Stanford. See her priceless reaction
description: Anderson Cooper shares the video of a teen who learned she was accepted to Stanford University. Watch "Full Circle" Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6p E.T.

title: Netanyahu's path to victory far from certain in Israel's fourth election in two years
description: Israelis are voting Tuesday in the country's fourth general election in under two years, with no guarantee that this poll will yield a more conclusive result than the previous three.

title: White headmaster at Catholic school told Black student to kneel and apologize 'the African way'
description: The White headmaster of a Catholic school on Long Island has been placed on leave following reports that he had a Black student kneel in apology last month, calling it "the African way" to apologize.

title: DOJ refers former Capitol riot prosecutor for investigation after '60 Minutes' interview
description: The Justice Department has referred former acting Washington US Attorney Michael Sherwin's unapproved interview with "60 Minutes" on Sunday about the Capitol riot cases to its Office of Professional Responsibility, a department lawyer said in court on Tuesday.

title: Acting Washington US Attorney: 'Unequivocal that Trump was the magnet'
description: CNN's Elie Honig breaks down what it may mean for sedition charges to be levied in the Capitol riot investigation.

title: NASA's Mars helicopter prepares for first powered flight on another planet
description: Humanity's first Wright Brothers moment on another planet will happen in April. The Ingenuity Mars helicopter will attempt the first powered flight on Mars no earlier than April 8, according to NASA.

title: Volcanic ash shuts down international airport in Guatemala
description: Guatemalan authorities have closed Guatemala's international airport as volcanic ash blanketed planes and runways on Tuesday.

title: 'It's so stupid': Tapper reacts to GOP senator's gun control remark
description: Sen. John Kennedy (R-LA) compared mass shootings to drunk driving incidents at a Senate hearing on gun violence following the deadly shooting in Boulder, Colorado. CNN's Jake Tapper reacts.

title: Author: Here's why I'm hopeful about gun reform
description: CNN's Christiane Amanpour talks to journalist and author Dave Cullen about the recent mass shooting in Boulder, Colorado, and the possibility of gun reform.

title: Ted Cruz accuses Democrats of 'ridiculous theater' after shootings
description: CNN's Manu Raju reports on the Senate Judiciary Committee holding a hearing on steps to reduce gun violence in America.

title: Supreme Court to discuss case that could expand Second Amendment rights
description: When Supreme Court justices meet behind closed doors Friday, a conference that comes three days after the country's latest mass shooting, they are scheduled to discuss whether to add a blockbuster issue to the docket for next term: the scope of the Second Amendment.

title: World's first digital NFT house sells for $500,000
description: Having spent so much time at home over the last year, many people are craving a change in their surroundings.

title: Concern raised about AstraZeneca vaccine data in unusual statement by review board
description: In an unusual statement released early Tuesday, the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases said the independent board that reviews data from multiple Covid-19 vaccine candidates has raised concerns about AstraZeneca's announcement of efficacy data from its vaccine trial.

title: Prince Harry has a new job
description: Prince Harry has officially arrived in California.

title: Putin gets Covid vaccine behind closed doors
description:
• Trial review board raises concerns about AstraZeneca vaccine data 
• Live updates: AstraZeneca stands by US trial results after expert group's concern
• Germany to go into hard lockdown

title: Dolphins take a swim up Venice's Grand Canal
description: Two dolphins have been spotted swimming up Venice's Grand Canal, and around Giudecca island. They were escorted out of the Venetian lagoon and back to the Adriatic.

title: Priyanka Chopra says she dismissed Nick Jonas early on
description: Oprah Winfrey interviewed actress and producer Priyanka Chopra about her relationship and fairytale wedding with musician Nick Jonas.

title: Ex-Trump lawyer argues that no reasonable people would believe her election fraud claims
description: Right-wing lawyer Sidney Powell is claiming in a new court filing that reasonable people wouldn't have believed as fact her assertions of fraud after the 2020 presidential election.

title: UN investigator says Saudi official threatened her life for role in Khashoggi probe
description: A top Saudi official issued a death threat against Agnès Callamard, the UN Special Rapporteur behind the investigation into the murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi, according to Callamard's office.

title: See how the UK marked a year since its first lockdown
description: On March 23, the UK marked one year since its first lockdown. Britons marked the occasion with a moment of silence: A small step in coming to grips with the unimaginable loss, and change to all of our lives. CNN's Phil Black reports.

title: Banksy painting celebrating nurses as superheroes sells for record sum
description: A painting by the artist Banksy honoring UK healthcare workers has set a new record for the artist, selling for £16.7 million ($23.1 million) at Christie's in London.

title: Pumped up Jimmy Fallon welcomes back live audience
description: A live studio audience returned to the set of the "The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon" for the first time in over a year.

title: By the end of the century, summer weather could last half a year
description: Summer weather could grow to half a year in length by the end of this century if no mitigation efforts are done on climate change, according to a new study. In about the past 60 years, summer has increased by 17 days on average across the globe.

title: Belize soccer team bus held up by 'insurgents on motorcycles' ahead of World Cup qualifier
description: Belize's football federation (FFB) expressed "disappointment and disgust" on Monday after the team bus carrying the squad from the airport to their hotel was stopped by "an uproar of insurgents with assault rifles on motorcycles."

title: Ethiopian leader says troops who raped civilians in Tigray will be held to account
description: Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed said Tuesday that his government would hold accountable any soldier found responsible for rape or looting in the country's conflict region of Tigray, just days after CNN and the UK's Channel 4 News published investigations into rape being used as a weapon of war against women.

title: McLaren signs long-term deal with 13-year-old karting star
description: McLaren Racing has signed a long-term agreement with 13-year-old Ugo Ugochukwu, a promising karting champion from the United States.

title: The first-ever tweet sold as an NFT for $2.9 million
description: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey sold the first-ever published tweet as an NFT, a digital collector's item of sorts. The final bid was $2.9 million.

title: New UK law means $7,000 fines for vacations abroad
description: British people attempting to go on vacation while travel restrictions are still in place could face a $7,000 fine under new government legislation.

title: New reasons to think the work-from-home revolution is overblown
description: One year after the Covid-19 pandemic forced millions of workers to start clocking in from home, many companies are thinking about how to bring their employees back into the office.

title: CNN anchor: Ex-Trump lawyer's defense might explode your brain
description: Right-wing lawyer Sidney Powell is claiming in a new court filing that reasonable people wouldn't have believed her assertions of fraud as fact after the 2020 presidential election. CNN's Elie Honig breaks down why he doesn't think this defense will work legally.

title: Is China overplaying its hand in countermeasures to the EU's sanctions?
The Olympic silver medalist delivering food for Uber Eats to fund his Tokyo 2020 dream
description: Olympic fencer Ryo Miyake took up a new job last year: delivering food for Uber Eats.

title: Emotional Zlatan Ibrahimovic reduced to tears on return to Sweden squad
description: Zlatan Ibrahimovic was reduced to tears in his first media conference since returning to Sweden international football squad while explaining his son's reaction to his call-up.

title: Australia hit with worst downpour in more than half a century
description: Australian authorities issued fresh flood warnings and evacuation orders on Tuesday as torrential rains again pummeled several parts of the country, sweeping away homes, roads and livestock in the worst downpour in more than half a century.

title: Concerns over social media stars traveling like there's no pandemic
description: When 21-year-old Daanish Hussain escaped London for Dubai over the New Year, he did what he does almost every day -- reached for his phone, and documented his journey for his 550,000 followers on TikTok.

title: Trump's army takes aim at 2022 touting his election lies
description: A long interview with a Fox News anchor. An even longer podcast with a Fox commentator. And a dinnertime phone call with a Newsmax TV personality.

title: Whistleblower reveals lewd behavior in Australian Parliament
description: Australia's Prime Minister Scott Morrison on Tuesday acknowledged mounting dissatisfaction with his handling of a series of allegations about the mistreatment of women in politics, as he vowed to drive cultural change.

title: Airborne lab flies 50 feet above the ocean
description: From the outside, you could easily mistake it for any other small passenger jet. But once you're inside, it's clear that this is not a typical aircraft.

title: Can your boss require you to get vaccinated?
description: We've heard it many times over the past few months: vaccines won't end the pandemic, vaccinations will. One way to increase vaccinations is for employers to require them in the workplace. But employers should not rush to do this. Although vaccine mandates are likely legal, other tools are probably better.

title: White House aides prep $3 trillion jobs package for Biden
description: White House advisers are expected to present a two-part, $3 trillion jobs and infrastructure proposal to President Joe Biden as soon as this week, according to two people familiar with the plan.

title: Robotic dog works wonders in ER in age of Covid-19
description: Dr. Spot, the robotic dog doctor, will see you now. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: See witness video of Colorado shooting
description: Video shows a person motionless on the ground inside a Boulder, Colorado, King Soopers supermarket following police reports of an active shooter at the location.

title: People roasted hot dogs on erupting volcano in Iceland
description: A volcano in Iceland erupted after tens of thousands of earthquakes disturbed the magma underground.

title: Governor calls Bolsonaro a 'psychopathic leader,' blames him for Covid deaths
description: The governor of Sao Paulo state has called Jair Bolsonaro a "psychopathic leader," in a sharp rebuke over the Brazilian President's response to the coronavirus pandemic.
